poem:
### The Glittered Race

In the flicker of flashbulbs,  
the dance spins—a confetti  
of celluloid dreams. Names  
like whispered ghosts drift  
across the velvet hush.  
Uncertain stars navigate  
the gilded fog, the glories  
unclaimed, trembling  
like unborn verses  
caught in the projector's  
unforgiving light.  
Hollywood breathes,  
exhaling shadows.  
A golden chase—  
ever elusive.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Hollywood ushers in hard-to-predict awards season with Golden Globes Another Hollywood awards season kicks off this weekend with the Golden Globes, the industry’s glitziest yet most consistently troubled ceremony. Nominations for the 82nd edition are led by films such as Netflix musical Emilia Pérez, period saga The Brutalist, Broadway blockbuster Wicked and Vatican thriller Conclave, and promises to help steer an unusually confused race that’s yet to firm up clear frontrunners. Last year was dominated". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Hollywood ushers in hard-to-predict awards season with Golden Globes Another Hollywood awards season kicks off this weekend with the Golden Globes, the industry’s glitziest yet most consistently troubled ceremony. Nominations for the 82nd edition are led by films such as Netflix musical Emilia Pérez, period saga The Brutalist, Broadway blockbuster Wicked and Vatican thriller Conclave, and promises to help steer an unusually confused race that’s yet to firm up clear frontrunners. Last year was dominated
